title: Information-Utilization Mathematics Learning Design: Online Instructional Design Based on Variation Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic math concepts and experience operating online learning platforms
context.additional_context: For current teachers and educational practitioners, requires integrated enhancement of information literacy and mathematical thinking skills

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more critical strategies for utilizing information in the process of solving mathematical problems.
Through variation theory-based learning activities, learners can identify five core characteristics of mathematical concepts.
Learners can complete a project modeling real-life problems mathematically by applying information-based learning design principles.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
